intro: Tetratheca thymifolia var. leiocarpum, commonly known as the silky tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
